sentences.en: A glass or two of wine will not significantly add to the calorie count.
sentences.cn: 喝一两杯葡萄酒不会增加多少热量。
一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.en: Coca - Cola introduced the first low calorie soft drink, " TAB. "
sentences.cn: 可口可乐 首先投放了低热量的饮料 “ TAB ”.

sentences.en: For engineering purposes, a larger unit called the kilo - calorie is adopted.
sentences.cn: 工程问题则使用较大的单位即 千卡 表示.

sentences.en: High calorie food was excepted from the menu since last year.
sentences.cn: 从去年开始,高卡路里食物就被从菜单上去掉了.

sentences.en: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.cn: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.en: Instead of high - calorie, high - fat desserts, enjoy seasonal, fresh fruits.
sentences.cn: 不要高卡路里, 高脂肪的甜点, 而是享受时令, 新鲜的水果.

sentences.en: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.cn: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

sentences.en: Nutritionists say only 33% of our calorie intake should be from fat.
sentences.cn: 营养学家说我们所摄入的卡路里中只应有33％来自脂肪。

sentences.en: Percent Daily Values ( DV ) are based on a 2 , 000 calorie diet.
sentences.cn: 每日所需标准百分比, 是以热量2000卡之膳食为 计算标准.

sentences.en: Reduced-calorie cheese is a great substitute for cream cheese.
sentences.cn: 低卡路里干酪是奶油干酪的极佳替代品。

sentences.en: The calorie is a historical relic.
The calorie is the unit usually used for measuring the amount of energy transfer in biochemistry.
sentences.cn: 生物化学中测定能量转移量的单位是大卡.

sentences.en: The diet imposes overall calorie limits, but daily menus are arbitrary.
sentences.cn: 食谱规定了总的热量限制, 但每天的菜单可据喜好自定.

sentences.en: The unit of heat energy commonly used in physics is the calorie.
sentences.cn: 在物理学中,热能单位一般用卡表示.

sentences.en: Turns out that green tea speeds up your body's calorie - burning process.
sentences.cn: 结果表明,绿茶能加速身体热量的燃烧.

sentences.en: Whateer the method, 99 percent of participants reduced oerall calorie intake.
sentences.cn: 无论采用何种方法, 99%的参与者都减少了热卡的入量.

phrases.tran_cn: 卡路里摄入量；热量摄取

trans.tran_cn: 卡路里，千卡(食物热量的单位)
trans.tran_en: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce
